prediction: A fire on Patalkot Express in Agra, UP, injures 2 passengers. Cause unknown, affecting train services.
reference: A fire on Patalkot Express in Agra, UP, injures 2 passengers. Cause unknown, affecting train services. By : Sentinel Digital Desk Published : 25 Oct 2023 7:46 PM | Updated : 25 Oct 2023 7:50 PM UTTAR PRADESH: In a distressing incident on a Wednesday afternoon, a fire broke out in two coaches of the Patalkot Express train, resulting in injuries to at least two passengers. The incident occurred in the Agra district of Uttar Pradesh as the train was en route from Firozpur Cantonment in Punjab to Seoni in Madhya Pradesh. The blaze engulfed the third and fourth coaches of the train, situated near the engine, at approximately 3:45 PM. Also Read - Mizoram Polls: Over Half of Candidates are Crorepatis; State AAP Chief Tops List The Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) from the Agra Police Commissionerate, Sonam Kumar, confirmed that two passengers sustained injuries in the fire and were promptly transported to a nearby hospital for medical attention. Responding to the emergency, five fire tenders and a forensic team swiftly reached the scene to tackle the situation. Agra Railway Division's Public Relations Officer, Prashasti Srivastava, reported that the precise cause of the fire remained unknown at that time. She stated, "A fire incident in Patalkot Express has been reported between Bhandai and Jajau in NCR (North Central Railway), Agra Division. Two coaches have been completely burnt. Since two adjacent coaches have also been affected, a total of four coaches have been detached from the train. The situation is under control." Also Read - New Delhi: NCERT Committee Suggests 'Bharat' Over 'India' in Textbooks and Indian Knowledge System in Curriculum Bhandai station, located approximately 10 kilometers from Agra station, marked the location where the fire began, shortly after the train left for its next station, Jajau. As soon as smoke was detected, railway officials halted the train and initiated the evacuation process to ensure the safety of passengers. This incident's repercussions extended to the Agra-Dholpur train route, impacting several train services. Numerous trains were brought to a standstill at various stations due to the emergency response and investigations conducted by railway authorities. Also Read - ‘Judges though not elected have a vital role to play’: Chief Justice of India DY Chandrachud The Patalkot Express typically runs its route between Firozpur Cantonment in Punjab and Seoni in Madhya Pradesh. As authorities work to ascertain the cause of the fire and ensure passenger safety, this incident serves as a stark reminder of the importance of vigilance and preparedness within the transportation sector. https://www.sentinelassam.com/national-news/agra-fire-erupts-in-patalkot-express-train-coaches-injuring-passengers-672424

Click here to join our channel (@thehansindia) and stay updated with the latest headlines More On amazonImages Next Story Amazon rolls out independent cloud for Europe to address stricter privacy standards AP | 25 Oct 2023 6:49 PM IST x HIGHLIGHTS Amazon is rolling out an independent cloud for Europe as it looks to address strict regulations that companies and those in the public sector face in the European Union. New York: Amazon is rolling out an independent cloud for Europe as it looks to address strict regulations that companies and those in the public sector face in the European Union. Amazon Web Services said on Wednesday that its AWS European Sovereign Cloud, which will be located in and operate out of Europe, will have the same security, availability, and performance as existing AWS regions but will be separate from them. The cloud will let customers keep all metadata they create in the European Union and will have its own billing and usage metering systems. “The AWS European Sovereign Cloud reinforces our commitment to offering AWS customers the most advanced set of sovereignty controls, privacy safeguards, and security features available in the cloud,” Max Peterson, vice president of Sovereign Cloud at AWS, said in a written statement. Transatlantic data protection has been a growing concern since the European Union's top court struck down a data sharing agreement in 2020 known as Privacy Shield. ADVERTISEMENT The court said at the time that the agreement, which allowed businesses to transfer data to the US under the EU's strict data privacy rules, was invalid because it didn't go far enough to prevent the American government from snooping on user data. In 2021 Microsoft said that it would let business and public sector customers in the European Union keep cloud computing data inside the 27-nation bloc to avert concerns about US government access to sensitive information. Amazon's AWS supports 143 security standards and compliance certifications, to help customers meet regulatory requirements. ADVERTISEMENT The company said that AWS is collaborating with European regulators and national cybersecurity agencies to build the AWS European Sovereign Cloud so that it is able to meet additional data residency, operational autonomy, and resiliency needs in Europe. Germany will be the first AWS Region within the AWS European Sovereign Cloud and will be available to all European customers. Only EU-resident AWS employees who are located in the EU will have control of the operations and support for the AWS European Sovereign Cloud. "The development of a European AWS cloud will make it much easier for many public sector organisations and companies with high data security and data protection requirements to use AWS services,” Claudia Plattner, president of the German Federal Office for Information Security, said. AWS infrastructure in Europe currently includes eight regions in Frankfurt, Ireland, London, Milan, Paris, Stockholm, Spain, and Zurich. prediction: The Madras High Court has quashed a notification issued by the Registrar of the National Company Law Board in 2017 prescribing a dress code for lawyers before all the Benches of the National Company Law Tribunal.
reference: The Madras High Court has ruled that tribunals have no authority to insist on lawyers appearing before them to wear black gowns compulsorily. This is because only the High Courts have the power to frame rules for the dress code of lawyers appearing before them or any subordinate courts or tribunals. The ruling came in response to a writ petition filed by advocate R. Rajesh, who challenged a notification issued by the Registrar of National Company Law Board in 2017 prescribing a dress code for lawyers. The petition argued that the notification was illegal since the NCLT had no authority to issue such instructions. The Division Bench of Justices R. Mahadevan and Mohammed Shaffiq agreed with the petitioner and quashed the 2017 notification. The judges held that tribunals cannot issue any instructions, directions or advisories which run contrary to the statutory rules and without there being any source of power to issue such instructions. The ruling is significant as it clarifies the legal position on the dress code of lawyers appearing before tribunals. It also reinforces the principle that tribunals cannot act beyond their jurisdiction.

reference: Switzerland's Nant de Drance water battery, unveiled on July 1, 2022, is a game-changer in renewable energy. Nestled in the Swiss Alps, this colossal battery took 14 years to build and can power 400,000 electric vehicle batteries. Acting as a pumped storage power plant, it utilizes water to store and release electricity through two reservoirs at different heights. Six turbines, located in 17 kilometers of underground tunnels, generate power as water rushes from the higher to the lower reservoir. The elevated Vieux-Emosson reservoir can now hold 25 million cubic meters of water. This eco-friendly superhero of energy storage can hold 20,000 megawatt hours and has a power rating of 900 megawatts. Not just a mountain treasure, Nant de Drance stabilizes electricity in Europe by storing excess energy during high production times and releasing it during peak demand, ensuring a cleaner and brighter energy future.

prediction: There is no sureshot way to find out if someone has blocked you on WhatsApp, but there are some ways to know if someone has blocked you.
reference: WhatsApp, a widely used messaging platform, may leave you wondering if someone has blocked you. While there's no foolproof method, certain indicators suggest a potential block: 1. No Last Seen or Online Status: If someone blocks you, WhatsApp hides their last seen and online status to safeguard privacy. 2. Profile Photo Updates: Blocked individuals won't see updates to the blocker's profile photo, a privacy measure by WhatsApp. 3. Message Status: Messages sent to a blocker show only one check mark (sent), not two (delivered), indicating the message was sent but not delivered. 4. Call Attempts: If you try calling a blocker, the call won't connect, as WhatsApp prevents it. Multiple signs for the same contact increase the likelihood of being blocked. However, these aren't foolproof, as users may disable status features or face internet issues. While these indicators offer clues, they don't guarantee someone has blocked you.

Meanwhile, cardamom prices dropped by 1.46% to Rs 1,228 per kg in the futures market due to weak demand, and mentha oil prices fell by 0.23% to Rs 1,213.50 per kg due to muted demand in spot markets.

prediction: Delhi's environment minister has called for the Centre to impose a stringent ban on buses running on subpar diesel in the National Capital Region, or NCR.
reference: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai has urged the Indian government to impose a strict ban on buses running on subpar diesel in the National Capital Region (NCR) areas of Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, and Rajasthan. He found that all buses registered in these regions were only BS III and BS IV vehicles during an inspection at the Kashmere Gate bus terminal. The Centre's Commission for Air Quality Management has already issued directions to allow only electric, CNG, and BS VI-compliant diesel buses between Delhi and NCR cities from November 1. Rai called for a complete ban on BS III and BS IV buses in the NCR.
